title: Priyanka Chopra wants James Bond role as she calls for female 007
text:
Priyanka Chopra’s new film, The Sky Is Pink, releases on 11 October (Picture: FilmMagic)

Daniel Craig’s last James Bond film, No Time To Die, has been moved up by a day, and will be released on 2 April.

But the speculation over who will take over as 007 doesn’t look like it will be dying down anytime soon – with Richard Madden, Idris Elba and Cillian Murphy among those tipped to replace him.

Amid a heated debate over whether a woman should be cast as the spy, Priyanka Chopra revealed she is desperate to see a female Bond.

And, speaking exclusively to Metro.co.uk ahead of The Sky Is Pink release, the 37-year-old confessed she would love to take on the role herself.

As well as a Marvel stint, of course.

‘I’ve always been keen on [playing James Bond] but I can’t put myself into the race obviously,’ she told us.

James Bond No Time To Die will be dropping next April (Picture: Splash)

‘I think, in my lifetime it would be amazing a female Bond. Whether that’s me or someone else, it’s something I would love to see.’

Which actress could Priyanka see stepping into Daniel’s suave shoes?

‘Me!,’ she joked.

‘I don’t know, I would just be very happy with the fact that it would be a woman.

‘I definitely think [it’s time].’

Priyanka would be down to play James Bond (Picture: Rex)

We might not have to wait too long for her vision to come to life…

It was recently revealed Lashana Lynch would be ‘introduced as 007’ in No Time To Die, in a moment that will reportedly have us all ‘dropping our popcorn in shock’.

An insider claimed there ‘a pivotal scene at the start of the film where M says, “Come in 007” and in walks Lashana, who is black, beautiful and a woman.’

While we don’t normally condone popcorn wasting, celebrating queen Lashana is more than enough reason to drop it.

Could Priyanka be the next Bond? (Picture: Rex)

The debate about whether or not we should finally be blessed with a female James Bond has raged on for years, and Joanna Lumley recently waded into the whole thing, adamant his replacement should be a man.

In a chat with Metro.co.uk about a possible casting, the Absolutely Fabulous actress said: ‘He took very special pains to describe James Bond, who was a man, and this was written in the early 50s, who was a British man of a certain height and build and a rather cruel face, a lean build.

‘It seems odd to me you’d make that a woman.’

While Bond star Ben Whishaw – who plays Q in the films – is keen for there to finally be a huge shake up to everyone’s favourite spy.

‘Why not? Reinvention of these long-running things is good – it’s essential in fact,’ he told PA. ‘So I think it could be amazing.’

Could Priyanka’s dream be about to come true?

The Sky Is Pink is released in cinemas on 11 October.
